name: flattered-themes
description: If you're a fan of a singular background color for any theme using the main editor's color to effectively make any theme a flat version, this is the extension for you

flattered.enabled.description: Allow Flattered to apply changes. (Reset Current Theme command will still work nonetheless)

enumDescriptions: Yes, auto apply when there's a change in the color theme or any Flattered setting
No, ignore any changes and Flattered will be applied manually by command
Ask if I want to apply a detected change
flattered.autoApply.description: Enable automatic apply Flattered on theme change, workbench.colorCustomizations, or Flatter setting change

flattered.colorSource.description: Set the source color to use as the background

flattered.customColor.description: Custom color (hex) to use when selected as source. If blank, will use editor background color

flattered.applyTo.titleBar.description: Apply Flattered color to title bar

flattered.applyTo.tabs.description: Apply Flattered color to editor tabs

flattered.applyTo.activityBar.description: Apply Flattered color to activity bar

flattered.applyTo.sideBarSectionHeader.description: Apply Flattered color to sidebar section headers

flattered.applyTo.panel.description: Apply Flattered color to bottom panel

flattered.applyTo.terminal.description: Apply Flattered color to integrated terminal

flattered.applyTo.statusBar.description: Apply Flattered color to status bar

flattered.backupColorCustomizations.description: Backup customizations tracked before applying in workbench.colorCustomizations (you don't really have to touch this)

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
